title: 'I f*cking hate Aberdeen' - New signing Christie embarrassed by foul-mouthed tweet
text:
0 Jan 24, 2017 21:35:59 The 21-year-old midfielder has moved to the Dons on loan, but a Twitter update from his past has been unearthed where he heaps abuse on his new club EXTRA TIME 
New Aberdeen signing Ryan Christie has deleted his Twitter account after a tweet abusing the Dons was found in his timeline. 
The 21-year-old midfielder has joined on loan from Celtic, but has been left embarassed by an update from 2012.

In the now-deleted tweet, Christie wrote: "C'mon Hibs! I f*cking hate Aberdeen #sheepshaggingc***s" 
After receiving multiple retweets and many negative replies, the Scotland Under-21 international deactivated his account on the social-media platform. 
Dons manager Derek McInnes made no mention of the offensive update in his first interview since the signing, telling the club's official website: "I am delighted to get a player of Ryan's quality into the club. 
"We want to make a couple of additions in the January window - quality additions - and there is no doubt Ryan has the quality to come in and make an impact with us. Ryan can help us with the challenges that lie ahead during the second half of the season. 
"I would also like to thank Brendan Rodgers and Celtic for assisting in getting the deal done." Related
